description: The system shall allow a logged-in user to create a new dispute record with customer identifier, dispute reason, and disputed amount.
The system shall display a list of existing dispute records filtered by customer identifier.
The system shall allow an authorized user to update the status of a dispute record to Open, In Progress, Resolved, or Closed.
The system shall prevent a user without supervisor privileges from changing the status of a dispute record to Closed.
The system shall record the date and time when the status of a dispute record changes.
The system shall allow an authorized user to attach one or more documents to a dispute record.
The system shall display the full history of status changes for a dispute record in chronological order.
The system shall allow a user to search for dispute records by status, creation date range, and customer identifier.
The system shall restrict access to dispute records so that a user can view only records assigned to that user or that user's team.
The system shall generate a daily summary listing the number of dispute records created, resolved, and closed on that day.
The system shall allow an authorized user to create a new event with name, start date, start time, and location.
The system shall display all upcoming events ordered by start date and start time.
The system shall allow a user to view detailed information for a selected event including description and organizer name.
The system shall allow an authorized user to cancel an event and record a cancellation reason.
The system shall send a notification to each registered participant when an event is cancelled.
The system shall prevent a user from registering for an event after the event start time.
The system shall allow a user to unregister from an event until two hours before the event start time.
The system shall record the date and time when a user registers for an event.
The system shall display the current number of registered participants for each event.
The system shall prevent the number of registered participants for an event from exceeding the configured capacity for that event.
The system shall allow an administrator to create a new user account with username, initial password, and assigned role.
The system shall require a user to change the initial password at the first successful login.
The system shall lock a user account after five consecutive failed login attempts within ten minutes.
The system shall unlock a locked user account only when an administrator explicitly unlocks the account.
The system shall allow an administrator to deactivate a user account so that the user can no longer log in.
The system shall record the date and time of the most recent successful login for each user account.
The system shall require a user to provide the current password before setting a new password.
The system shall terminate a user session after thirty minutes of inactivity.
The system shall log each failed login attempt with the entered username and time of the attempt.
The system shall allow an administrator to assign one or more predefined roles to a user account.
The system shall prevent a customer from submitting an order that contains no line items.
The system shall calculate the total price of an order as the sum of all line item prices and applicable taxes.
The system shall assign a unique identifier to each new order at the time the order is created.
The system shall allow a customer to view the current status of each order placed by that customer.
The system shall allow an authorized user to change the status of an order to Pending, Confirmed, Shipped, or Cancelled.
The system shall prevent modification of order line items after the order status changes to Shipped.
The system shall record the date and time when an order status changes to Shipped.
The system shall allow a customer to cancel an order while the order status is Pending.
The system shall send an order confirmation notification to the customer when an order status changes to Confirmed.
The system shall allow an authorized user to apply a percentage discount to an order before the order is confirmed.
The system shall allow an authorized user to register a new product with product name, product code, and unit price.
The system shall store the current stock quantity for each product in inventory.
The system shall decrease the stock quantity of a product when a confirmed order includes that product.
The system shall increase the stock quantity of a product when a stock receipt is recorded for that product.
The system shall prevent the stock quantity of a product from falling below zero.
The system shall allow an authorized user to set a reorder threshold quantity for each product.
The system shall list all products whose stock quantity is less than or equal to the configured reorder threshold.
The system shall record the date and time when a stock receipt is entered into the system.
The system shall allow an authorized user to mark a product as inactive so that it no longer appears in new orders.
The system shall generate a weekly inventory report listing current stock quantity for each active product.
The system shall allow an authorized user to generate a summary report of all orders created within a selected date range.
The system shall allow a user to export the generated report as a comma-separated values file.
The system shall display the parameters used to generate a report at the top of the report output.
The system shall restrict access to financial reports to users with the Finance role.
The system shall record the date, time, and user identifier for each report generation request.
The system shall allow an authorized user to schedule a report to run automatically at a specific time each day.
The system shall store the ten most recent completed report files for each scheduled report definition.
The system shall allow an authorized user to deactivate a scheduled report so that it is no longer executed.
The system shall display an error message if a user attempts to access a report for which that user does not have permission.
The system shall generate an audit log entry each time a user exports a report file.
